avalancheActivity.highlights: A lot of new snow is in the region. Wind slabs have formed in the mountains after SW-snow showers and strong winds. Ongoing snow showers in the next days further encourage wind slab and cornice formation on N- and E- aspects. Earthquake swarm by Bláfjöll and people recommended to take care under steep terrain.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow is covering the region after persistent strong SW- snow fall in the last days and short E wind on Monday. Wind slabs have formed on N- and E- facing aspects and unstable wind slabs are widespread. Ongoing snow fall and SW winds will continue forming wind slabs and cornices in the mountains in the next days. Little snow is underneath the new snow in most places and people traveling in the mountains should be careful of rocks underneath the wind slab. Becoming warmer on Thursday with rain.

travelAdvisory.comment: New wind slabs have formed in most parts during SW snow showers in the last days. Most precipitation has been in South- and West parts but little snow was present before. Warming last week in all regions made the snowpack uniform and isothermal, notably in North Iceland where a persistent weakness was widespread and may still be found at high elevations.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. Ongoing SW directions in the next days and snowfall continue forming wind slabs on N and E aspects. Temporary thaw on Friday.

weatherForecast.highlights: Suðvestan 8-15 m/s eða breytilega átt og él næstu daga. Hlýnar á fimmtudag með rigningu.

avalancheActivity.comment: Many avalanches, most of them small, released in the area during and after heavy but short snowfall and snowdrift on early Thursday 25 January.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has been added in snow showers and snowdrift in variable southerly winds the last days. Unstable wind slabs can have built up in mountains, especially in gullies and slopes facing W-N-E. Continuing similar weather in the forecast, and avalanche danger is expected to increase gradually.

snowpackStructure.highlights: During the last week, snow has added and drifted in variable wind, especially SW. Before, there was little snow in the area. The night before Thursday, it snowed heavily for a while, first in NE directions, then in E and SW directions. As a result, many small avalanches released in the forecast area, on slopes facing various directions. Now there is considerable new snow in the area and continuing snow showers in variable southerly winds are forecasted. Wind slabs are expected to have formed and should continue to build up the next days, especially in gullies, depressions and slopes facing W-N-E.

travelAdvisory.comment: New wind slabs have formed in most parts during SW snow showers in the last days. Most precipitation has been in South- and West parts but little snow was present before. Warming last week in all regions made the snowpack uniform and isothermal, notably in North Iceland where a persistent weakness was widespread and may still be found at high elevations.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. Ongoing SW directions in the next days and snowfall continue forming wind slabs on N and E aspects. Temporary thaw on Friday.

weatherForecast.highlights: Áframhaldandi éljagangur næstu daga í breytilegum suðlægum áttum, samfelldari snjókoma á mánudagskvöld. Ekki mjög efnismikil él en skafrenningur getur valdið hraðari snjósöfnun í gil, lægðir og hléhlíðar.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few avalanches occurred last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Windslabs are present on N-E aspects after SW-winds and further windslab formation is expected in the next few days. Weak layers could be present in the snowpack, especially at high elevations.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Windslabs are present, especially on N-E aspects after SW-winds. Snowfall and further windslab formation is expected in the next few days. A snowpit from Siglufjarðarskarð on Jan 29 showed a weak layer on 18 cm and another one on 30 cm.

travelAdvisory.comment: New wind slabs have formed in most parts during SW snow showers in the last days. Most precipitation has been in South- and West parts but little snow was present before. Warming last week in all regions made the snowpack uniform and isothermal, notably in North Iceland where a persistent weakness was widespread and may still be found at high elevations.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. Ongoing SW directions in the next days and snowfall continue forming wind slabs on N and E aspects. Temporary thaw on Friday.

weatherForecast.highlights: Áframhaldandi SV-læg átt og él en norðlæg átt um tíma á miðvikudag. Hlýnandi veður á fimmtudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few avalanches occurred in Norðfjörður on Jan 27. A small wet sluff occurred above Neskaupstaður during thaw on Jan 25.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The new snow has drifted during SW/S winds and formed thin windslabs that could be unstable. Considerable snowfall is forecasted on Wednesday during northerly winds.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Thin windslabs could have formed since the thaw last Thursday, especially on N-E aspects, gullies and lows. Considerable snowfall is forecasted on Wednesday during northerly winds so windslabs could also form on southerly aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: New wind slabs have formed in most parts during SW snow showers in the last days. Most precipitation has been in South- and West parts but little snow was present before. Warming last week in all regions made the snowpack uniform and isothermal, notably in North Iceland where a persistent weakness was widespread and may still be found at high elevations.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. Ongoing SW directions in the next days and snowfall continue forming wind slabs on N and E aspects. Temporary thaw on Friday.

weatherForecast.highlights: SV/V 5-13 m/s og líkur á dálítilli snjókomu en snýst í N-V 13-18 m/s á miðvikudag með talsverðri snjókomu. Á fimmtudag er útlit fyrir SV-átt með hlýnandi veðri.
